meanings.definition: A group of singers performing together.
meanings.sent1: The chorusing of the choir filled the hall with beautiful music.
meanings.sent2: The school choir's chorusing at the concert was impressive.
meanings.sent3: The chorusing of the birds in the morning made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The chorusing of the waves against the shore was like nature's own symphony.
meanings.sent5: The chorusing of the church choir echoed through the old building.

meanings.definition: The act of singing in unison.
meanings.sent1: Their chorusing of the national anthem was moving.
meanings.sent2: The family's chorusing of happy birthday was heartfelt.
meanings.sent3: The chorusing of the children in the school play brought tears of joy to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The chorusing of the crowd at the concert created a sense of unity.
meanings.sent5: The chorusing of the fans during the game energized the players.

meanings.definition: The simultaneous repetition of a musical phrase by different voices or instruments.
meanings.sent1: The chorusing of the violins added depth to the music piece.
meanings.sent2: The chorusing of the trumpets in the orchestra was powerful.
meanings.sent3: The chorusing of the guitars in the band practice sounded like a fun chaos.
meanings.sent4: The chorusing of the drums and cymbals created a rhythmic pattern.
meanings.sent5: The chorusing of the flutes in the ensemble was delicate and harmonious.
